pageContext.claim: “In fact, President Obama, when he signed the DACA with the executive order, made a statement to the effect, this isn't going to work. … And then it was upheld by the Ninth Circuit Appellate, and now it's going before the United States Supreme Court.”
pageContext.analysis: Obama never said his executive order on DACA was illegal. His administration argued in court that the order was “a lawful exercise of the enforcement discretion that Congress delegated to the executive branch in the Immigration and Nationality Act, which charges the executive with ‘the administration and enforcement’ of the country’s immigration laws,” as the ACLU put it.
